trends: There have been 52 other sightings in Lee's Summit
There were no other sightings in Lee's Summit on or around July 3rd 2011
Object Flight Path: Path with directional change,Path then hovering
divs: Sighting DetailsI was out in my front yard at about 10 p.m. this evening watching the neighborhood fireworks going off. As I turned to go back in the house, I spotted a bright orange light moving slowly across the sky coming from the northwest. At first I thought it might be an airplane, but the light was too big, and the object was moving much too slowly to be a plane, and there was no sound. It came to a dead stop, and I must admit, chills ran all through me, I couldn't believe what I was seeing. It hovered for a few minutes, then it moved off to the east and went behind some clouds. As it hovered I noticed that on each side of the orange light there was dimly lit rectangular windows. I did not have my camera with me, so I did not get any pictures. Did anyone else see this object around 10 p.m. on July 3, 2011 over the Kansas City area? I can't believe I am the only one who saw it, since there were so many fireworks going off and people would be looking upwards in the sky. The object would have passed over I-70 and Noland Road and would have been plainly visable from the ball park (although I don't think there was a game tonight)
